thread.title: 'Black Love Power' Combats Google's Racist Search Results for 'Couples in Love'
thread.title_full: 'Black Love Power' Combats Google's Racist Search Results for 'Couples in Love' | Complex

author: Trace William Cowen
title: 'Black Love Power' Combats Google's Racist Search Results for 'Couples in Love'
text:
'Black Love Power' Combats Google's Racist Search Results for 'Couples in Love' By Trace William Cowen happy to waste more of your time here: @tracecowen 
  Image via @BlackLovePower Black Love Power , a digital platform for "powerful images of black people engaging in acts of love," launched Tuesday. Founded by activists Dabo Ch√© and Michaela Angela Davis, Black Love Power was inspired in part by the unfortunate lack of diversity displayed when Googling "couples in love" and related phrases.
  A post shared by HuffPost BlackVoices (@blackvoices) on Feb 14, 2017 at 5:33am PST
Davis and Ch√© launched their new campaign in collaboration with the Huffington Post 's Black Voices on Valentine's Day, releasing a curated gallery of work from their network of talented black photographers. "Black is big, generous, and mystical," Davis told the Post . "Love is the most transformative energy there is. Power is what all people want. So Black Love Power, for me, is a reinforcement of, who we are, what we‚Äôre made of and what we have."
  Praises #blacklovematters #blackloveisbeautiful #blacklovepower #blackfathers 
A post shared by Black Love Power (@blacklovepower) on Jan 28, 2017 at 8:22am PST
  A post shared by Black Love Power (@blacklovepower) on Jan 30, 2017 at 2:18pm PST
Black Love Power, Davis added , is "an act of resistance" aimed at reimagining the ways in which black love is perceived. According to Ch√©, this new digital platform can help "make us less reactionary to how other people treat us" and will provide a place for community exploration.
  A mother's love is unmatched. üì∑ by @maximushka #BlackLovePower #HPBVValentinesDay ‚ù§Ô∏è 
A post shared by HuffPost BlackVoices (@blackvoices) on Feb 14, 2017 at 6:50am PST
  Sisterly love and beautiful geomatic hairstyles ‚ù§Ô∏è#BlackLovePower #HPBVValentinesDay üì∑ by @creativesoulphoto 
A post shared by HuffPost BlackVoices (@blackvoices) on Feb 14, 2017 at 7:55am PST
  ‚ÄúBlack Love is a SUPER Power, we need to simply activate [it]," says Michaela Angela Davis, co-founder of #BlackLovePower. #HPBVValentinesDay üì∑ by @artemusjenkins 
A post shared by HuffPost BlackVoices (@blackvoices) on Feb 14, 2017 at 10:31am PST
"This is a platform where we can explore relationships, politics, sex, economics and all things that can positively affect ourselves, our community, and ultimately the world we live in," Ch√© told the Post .
The debut curated gallery features work from photographers including Maxim Vakhovskiy, Creative Soul, Artemus Jenkins, and more. Peep it here . For those interested in contributing work, you can find more info on the submission process right here. 
Tags: News , Google , Photography , Valentines Day , race
